sentences.english: B: Well, we went bungee jumping when we were in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 哦，在澳大利亞的時候我們去玩了蹦極跳。

sentences.english: We went bungee jumping when we were in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 在澳大利亞的時候我們去了蹦極跳。

sentences.english: Well, we went bungee jumping when we were in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 的時候我們去玩了蹦極跳。

sentences.english: My favorite hobby is bungee jumping.
sentences.chinese: 我最大的嗜好就是蹦極跳。

sentences.english: The jumps coincide with the 40th anniversary of the tower's construction.
sentences.chinese: 這次蹦極活動恰逢電塔建成40週年。

sentences.english: Sally said I should try Bungee, but I had cold feet.
sentences.chinese: 莎莉說我應該體驗一下蹦極，但是我就是不敢。

sentences.english: We went bungee jumping when we were in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 在澳大利亞的時候我們去玩了蹦極。

sentences.english: A: It was stupid of me to go bungee jumping.
sentences.chinese: 我居然去蹦極，真是太蠢了。

sentences.english: Rapp was considering a bungee jump himself during an upcoming summer trip to Norway.
sentences.chinese: Rapp正考慮在即將到來的夏天去挪威蹦極呢。

sentences.english: The nosewheel strut uses a single heavy-duty bungee for shock absorbency.
sentences.chinese: 在前輪支撐蹦極使用稅爲吸收衝擊單重。

sentences.english: Question: Imagine you have to either bungee jump or skydive. Which would you choose?
sentences.chinese: 如果要玩蹦極跳或者跳傘。你會選哪個？

sentences.english: Bungee jumping is avery new X-sport, but it has become popular all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 蹦極是一項新的極限運動，但它在全世界越來越流行。

sentences.english: Why not suggest bungee jumping as the first date?
sentences.chinese: 你的首次約會別選類似“蹦極”的事。

sentences.english: Excitement makes some people do some dumb and silly things, like bungee jumping.
sentences.chinese: 興奮會讓人作出一些愚蠢無聊的事，就像蹦極跳。

sentences.english: Skydiving and bungee jumping are a common topic of conversation.
sentences.chinese: 跳傘和蹦極已經成了人們日常談論的話題。

definition: the trip has not been made in vain/the trip has been well worthwhile/it's been a worthwhile trip
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
to travel around (the world, a country etc)
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
to play/to have fun/to hang out
